review: The wait is worth it. You can easily split a dish. The banana cheesecake is to die for.

VERY disappointed with the service I received. I called 10 minutes in advance to get an idea of how long we were going to wait. I knew it would be long because they just opened. They stated it would be 30 minutes. I repeated it back to be sure and ended the call as I was pulling up in the parking lot. I walked through the door and was printed out a ticket for 2-2 1/2 hour wait. I advised of the conversation I just had, and they advised that that's just how it was. I took my ticket, grabbed a quick app with a friend to hold us over since we skipped out on lunch, and proceeded to walk the mall to kill time. After 2 1/2 hours, I still received no call to inform a table for 4 was ready...at this point it was 9:45 pm on a Thursday...I gave one star for the ticketing system that I found useful. That's it. Looks like I'll be going to the Cheesecake Factory in Atlanta instead to be sure that I'll receive good food and service.

We had to wait 1 hour to eat then we had to get in another line to be seated. The waitress was adequate but not great. The food was very tasty but made me sick. I had soup and salad. Our main complaint was that the music was so loud one had to shout to be heard. We could not wait to finish. We do not recommend this restaurant.

Went to the cheesecake factory for dinner on 8/2 around 7:30. We had a table of 6. We were seated and ordered an appetizer which came right out. We then placed our order for food which consisted of spaghetti, herb crusted parmesean chicken and chicken madiera. It took about 45 minutes before we received our food. The waitress kept apologizing but the food still wasn't coming. After 45 minutes the food finally came and i waited another 15 minutes for a side of broccoli that was ordered the same time as my meal. We asked for a manager. A woman (can't remember her name) came to the table admitted that the normal wait time to receive your food should be able 20 minutes. When we ecplained that we had waited 45 minutes, she did a bunch of apologizing, wished us well and walked off. The food was good but the service was unacceptable and I didn't feel like our business mattered.

I would like to thank Shirley R. (CHEESECAKE FACTORY Greenville,SC). Shirley was our waitress tonight and she was great!...Shirley helped me with the items on the menu; which was delicious!!..It was very busy at the time of night that we were there but her personality, service and attitude was so pleasant!..I hope that when we visit again in the near future that   we will be lucky enough to have Shirley as our waitress again! Thanks,  The Vickerys

As a visitor to the US, I have always wanted to try a Cheesecake Factory.  The reviews of this venue weren't the best and I had serious doubts about trying it.  I'm glad I did.  It was about 6pm on a Wednesday night and was very busy.  I was seated in 5 minutes (no booking) and I was served at a reasonable speed.  The lemonade was far too sweat for my likings but the burger was very tasty.  I took a Reeses Cheesecake away and whilst a little heavy it was enjoyable.

My husband was dying to try this place out as soon as it opened! We were waiting before it opened and it did not disappoint! Given the circumstances (about 150 people waiting to be seated or eating) we got our food rather quickly. My husband had the Louisiana chicken pasta and I had the Chicken and Biscuits. Both entrees were delicious! My only complaint-- we had multiple servers approach us and tell us they were our servers, and when asked if we wanted to go drinks, we never received them and were left very thirsty eating our Oreo cheesecake together! Other than that, it was FANTASTIC! Highly recommend!

Get the Mac and Cheese burger - it is phenomenal! And the cheesecake menu is about a mile long. Something for everyone  The biggest downfall was that we had to wait 2 hours for our table. But, it's at the mall, so you can do some shopping while you wait!
50 minutes to get food and it wasn't that busy.  Dirty plates.  Don't waste your time or money.

Waited fifty minutes for a frozen cheesecake. Told upon ordering it would be 10 minutes. All I got was an I'm sorry from the manager. I know it's your first weekend but this is how you lose customers really fast.

I only got cheesecake so the 5 stars are completely based on that. Today was the grand opening and the joint was a mad house of people. I knew there was no way of getting dinner but I couldn't help myself I had to get a slice of cheesecake so I thought it would be a quick drop in by the display case and get a slice to go but to my surprise i had to wait thirty minutes just to get a slice of cake...I wasn't the only one who couldnt help themselves! I got the tiramisu, lemon meringue, and key lime cheesecake and they were well worth the wait! And not to mention I loved the decor inside...very elegant! Update, I had lunch there today with four family members. The whole experience took 4 hrs. Checked in at 1:20 & didnt leave till 5. took an hour to be seated which was expected being that the place is new. It took 10 mins before we were waited on, 10 mins to get the coffee we ordered which was luke warm. Another 10 mins before we got the fried zucchini for appetizer. It was ok, cut a little too thick for my liking but batter was tasty. Another 15-20 min before we got to order entrées. I got the buffalo blasts Chicken, Cheese and Our Spicy Buffalo Sauce all Stuffed in a Spiced Wrapper and Fried until Crisp. Served with Celery Sticks and Blue Cheese Dressing. It sounds better than i thought they actually tasted. Daughter got macaroni cheese burger  Charbroiled and Topped with our Creamy Fried Macaroni and Cheese Balls and Cheddar Cheese Sauce. Served with Lettuce, Tomato, pickless, Onion and Mayo. It was pretty good but it was a very thick burger which I dont like. Sister had chicken marsalla Chicken Breast Sauteed with Fresh Mushrooms in a Rich Marsala Wine Sauce. Served over Bow-Tie Pasta...it was ok not bad but Ive had better. Mom had filet mignon served with salad and mash potatoes. She enjoyed it and said the cake was seaoned and cooked perfectly Aunt had FRIED SHRIMP PLATTER Lightly Breaded and Fried Crisp with French Fries and Cole Slaw. She enjoyed it. We each got a cheesecake: salted carmel, snickers, white choc macadamia, choc moose, and a low carb. All were delicious! 1 star fir great decor 1 star for clean bathrooms, one star for friendliness, 1 star for great cheesecake. I will be back to try other dishes, but the food we had today just didnt do it for me to give it 5 stars

Every Cheesecake Factory that I have ever been to has had at least an hour wait.  However, this one has been the longest wait.  On a Sunday night, the wait was 2 hours.  The quote was 1.5-2 hours.  Even the line to order to go which included just cheesecake orders was 30-40 minutes.  Service was slow as well.   At least the food was good.  The pasta da vinci, the pepper chicken, and the bbq chicken salad were all good and the salad portions were huge (Cheesecake factory style).  The pasta serving was not on par with what I expect from Cheesecake Factory.  I finished it and was still hungry.  This should not happen when I eat here.  We also got drinks.  11.50 for a Long Island Iced Tea.  After two of them, I didn't feel any different.  That's either a testament to my alcoholism or the drinks weren't very strong.  The latter is probably more true.  My group decided to get some cheesecake to go, and it took 20 minutes.  Come on.  The whole experience from arrival time to leaving was 4 hours.  The only consolation was that there was great people watching. From what I have heard, lunch can be just as crazy.  What I would recommend is go when the mall is still open (note that the mall closes at 6 on Sundays) and then put your name down.  Then go hang out at the mall.  Then come back.  Or...just go to Charlotte or Atlanta.

Had multiple bad experiences.   First similar situation as other review.  Called to check and see how long wait was and we were 5 minutes away.   We're told 30 minutes wait and I dropped my wife off at the door to check in and she was told 1 hour and 45 minutes.   Next experience was pick up order and waited 1 hour when told it would be ready in 30 minutes.  We got back to the house 20 minutes later to find the kids meal and cheesecake was not in our to go order and we had already paid.    Called and spoke to manager and she said refunds have to be mailed from corporate and we were issued a Cheesecake Factory card for $20 which may have been a couple dollars more than the items left out.   Kids were upset and without food and we have a gift card instead of refund which would rather had given the bad experiences.   The second curbside they left off all the sauce from our lettuce wraps which is the reason we ordered and had asked for extra.    Poorly run and managed store without changes over past 3 months.   I hesitated to write this review but feel that is necessary due to them having plenty of time to work out the kinks of the new store opening. Save yourself the headache and eat elsewhere.

I've been to many Cheesecake Factory's in my life and this is by far the worst. Where I used to live there were 3 near me and each of them were great. For some reason the Greenville location is not the same. The reason I gave 2 stars and not 1 is because they do have great drinks and cheesecake. The Georgia Peach is my favorite drink even though it is pricey at $11.50, I think it's worth it. Nothing that was ordered at my table was very good, it tasted like it was frozen and reheated. The service was slow and spotty. It took multiple reminders to get water refills, boxes, and the check. Even though the entrees were not good, I got cheesecake to go because it will taste the same at any CF you go to because the cheesecake is not made on site. I was surprised to see this Cheesecake Factory only had a 2.5 star rating, but after being there I understand.

Haven't actually tried it. Although our party did try to get seated, we just lost our patients. The wait wasn't worth it. We went there on June 11 2016 which was a Saturday a little before 4pm.  Our wait time was estimated to be 2 1/2 hours. They did not have enough buzzer, so we gave them our Cell number to buzz us instead. The hostess told us if we did not show back within 5 minutes once they buzz us. We will loose our seating as this was a very busy night. There were Apx. 80 groups ahead of us. So we were in the mall just to kill time. When 6 O'clock came by. We we went back to check. The hostess said that there will be at least another hour wait as there were still 30 groups ahead of us. By 7pm, we were hungry and couldn't wait anymore, and if we did wait we probably would have to wait another hour just to get our food. So we left to Applebees next door which we were greeted and seat ASAP. It wasn't until almost 8:30pm that they finally gave us a call to tell us a table is ready. By then, we were already done with our food and heading home already.  I tried CCF at other locations, and as good as there food goes. It isn't worth the wait to wait around for 5 hours. Compare this CCF to other locations, this one is small. Knowing that it would always stay jam packed. CCF should of have made a decision to make this a bigger restaurant with more seating.

So disappointed. :( After waiting 75+ minutes to get a table and another 60+ minutes to get our food, we were soooo disappointed! Everything was just OK. Nothing was good. We ordered pizza, pasta and two specialty chicken dishes. We won't waste our time or money again. There are much better restaurants for less in Greenville! The cheesecake was good, but that took an additional 45+ minutes to get after we ordered it and paid our check. They need to focus on fewer items on their menu and make them taste good. Consider taking reservations so everyone isn't milling around. I don't get what all the hype is about. We won't be back any time soon.  We wasted about 4+hours of our life.

They told us it was going to be 55-75 minutes but it was only 40! (On a Friday early afternoon) Service was good. Food was good and the restaurant is beautiful. Just go people - but do your research - expect a wait (and maybe be pleasantly surprised) and look over the menu online. Their menu is MASSIVE

As a regular of TCF, this was my first time at this location, and I'm happy to say this is a great spot, friendly service, great food. In response to some of these other comments, relax, and factor in wait time to your visit--if a place is popular, you don't just walk in anytime and expect to be seated immediately, go to fastfood if you want that.

Nice - like every other Cheesecake Factory, but with friendly Southern extras. Seriously, everyone was super friendly and had great things to say about working there. The wait was long but my group planned well enough to get there in time to snag a spot at the bar. So we waited with watered down drinks. Really, no complaints there because - well we were there for Cheesecake :) Despite having a 251 item menu everyone in my party said we always get the same thing no matter which city we visit. So this time i ventured out and tried the shepherds pie. Delicious! The burrito was another winner at the table.  The cheesecake factory is a popular restaurant no matter where it is. So there will always be a wait. Best to go with a fun group and enjoy it!

This location has a lot to learn from the Charlotte location. I live in Charlotte but my boyfriend lives in Greenville. He fell in love with the food at the Cheesecake Factory in Charlotte. He found out there was a location 10 minutes away and he was craving a particular pasta. So when I arrived, we headed straight to your restaurant. We were greeted by the hostess and waited for 30 minutes, which is great compared to the Charlotte location. We had a nice waitress but the food was horrible. My boyfriend was terribly disappointed because he had his mouth set on that pasta. We waited forever to receive our food. The wait was ridiculous, considering that there were not that many people in the restaurant. Since we had this experience, we will not be coming back and now I have to make a pit stop at the Charlotte location before coming to Greenville.

THERE WILL BE WAITS BECAUSE THE RESTAURANT IS 1/3 of THE CHARLOTTE LOCATION. With that being said- my friend and I went to lunch at 2pm on a Saturday and only had to wait 10 minutes. Our food was AMAZING and the Hershey's cheesecake was to die for. Great new addition to Greenville.

The chicken and waffles were disgusting. I've been craving chicken and waffles and after this, I may never want it again. Why would you put hollandaise sauce and poached egg on top of chicken and waffles? I sent it back asking if they would make another without all the stuff on top. It was at least 20 minutes before I got a new plate, and she brought it back still with poached egg on top. The entire plate of food was tasteless. The chicken was bland and all I tasted was breading, the waffle was not fluffy and the home fries...the best way I can describe it is little square pieces of grease. I was so turned off I didn't even order cheesecake. And the waitress never asked if my food was OK, because I'm sure by my facial expressions she knew I didn't like it. This place is so overrated. And people are crazy to wait an hour and  a half to two hours to eat here.

The service on our first visit here was terrible. We were seated at out table and were never approached by a server for a full 10 minutes. We then flagged a manager down and they said they would find one for us. Another manager (I think) came by and took our order and he said he still didn't know who our server was. Finally our server brought our drinks. We saw her maybe 3 times after that. The food was good as always, but the poor service is a definite turn off.

I was super excited about the Cheesecake Factory coming to Greenville . Until now we had to go to Charlotte or Atlanta . Well first of all we were told there was a 30 minute wait . That is very doable . It was also very accurate , we were seated in 29 minutes . We took time to look at the beauty of the place . It really is pretty although kinda small . I was surprised they wasted so much spaced for outside seating . When it's 93 degrees no one is going to sit outside . We did pick out our favorite cheesecakes . I had been waiting on the Key lime and my friend wanted Banana Cream. We were seated and ordered appetizers . We had a mozzarella tomato toast and spinach dip .    The toast was amazing , the dip was awful . The waiter never cared we only took one bite . We then moved on to Cheese Cake and Coffee . We ordered only to find out they sold out of my key lime on a Friday at 3:00 pm . I was not happy . I got the raspberry lemon and it was not good .  So $28 for a ok meal .  It certainly did not measure up to Charlotte or Atlanta .  Pretty Sad .  Will go back and try to get my key lime but will pass on the food .  Update :  Went in tonite for just Cheesecake and coffee for 3 and to get Cheesecake to carry home . We were told a 10 minute wait , no problem . We were seated quickly so that was positive . The waitress did not hide the fact she wasn't happy we were dessert only people . We ordered , my friend wanted the pumpkin cheesecake and was told very sharply that , that wasn't a option because they were out . She ordered another flavor , I got key lime and my daughter got Red Velvet . Two of us asked for no whip cream . We were served quickly . All three had whip cream !  Why ?  The waitress was not listening , she wanted to turn tables . We never got a refill of coffee but my daughter was given a "to go" cup with out to go order .  So if you just want Cheesecake please take it home as they are not interested in serving you ! I had no desire to see a manager due to all the negative reviews and they still can't get people who care to work there .

Our first time trying out the Cheesecake Factory. Tried to get in last Saturday, it was packed, with lots of people waiting, decided to try again mid week. Went for late lunch and had very short wait. Wow, quite an extensive menu! In the end I went for the chicken salad, which came with fries, my husband decided on the California Cheesesteak, which also came with fries. Both were very good. For the size of the Cheesesteak sandwich we felt price was a little much ($13.95). Might consider serving on smaller plate to make portion seem larger? Also would suggest adding something to the plates for presentation sake (pickle?) All in all, for lunch, to us, it's rather expensive, $42 and change including $7 tip. That also included a slice of their original cheesecake.Our waitress was super attentive and very personable. Oh, our waitress also brought us bread with our meals, tho' didn't see the need since we had sandwiches, but the bread was hard as a rock, waitress said "yeah, it's ciabatta bread"..... Will we go back? Maybe, but it's not on our list of places we definitely want to go back to. After all the hype, we were not impressed

While waiting for a table we went to the bar for a drink. No service for 15 minutes. Not even an acknowledgment from the bartenders (they never scanned the bar). We left and went to the Yard House and prompt happy service.

I was excited to hear CF was coming to the upstate and finally got around to going last weekend. There was a bit of a wait, but it was worth it. I ordered the fettuccini Alfredo which was delicious and filling, and ended the meal with a slice of salted caramel cheesecake. It was heavenly. I look forward to visiting again soon.

What a big disappointment. We visited your restaurant today at 4:30 pm. I have been waiting to visit your restaurant since I have heard of you coming here. I visited a Cheesecake factory in Florida and it was Great. So I have been raving about your cashew chicken. Our order came and after my first bite it tasted like salt. I took another bite and again pure salt nothing else. I gave my wife a bite and she said it was pure salt. Finally our waitress came and informed her of the problem. After she left manager Steve came and said it has a little too much garlic. Hmmmm I live garlic but this was like eating pure salt. After he left the waitress came and said you want your bill and within seconds it was there but my wife was still eating her dinner. We felt like we was rushed so we paid and left. Don't go there

I would give this place 0 stars if it would let me. I made a short trip to Greenville and I realized my hotel was near the Cheesecake Factory so we decided to shop in the mall until it opened. Several people lined up at the ENTRANCE inside the mall and we were waiting when suddenly a large line formed outside with people who hadn't waited as long as we had. Note that several security officers pasted by us to monitor the larger line and failed to say anything until 11:29 right before the doors were about to open. A security officer walked up to the people waiting in the inside mall line and said this will be the end of the line. We said uh no we've been waiting a long time. He said well sorry you should've been in the other line and walked off. So bottom line is we got the shaft. We went to papas n beer. I will never return to this Cheesecake Factory ever again!! If you advertise an entrance then that's what it should be. Why don't you have a sign stating otherwise if it's not a blank entrance. We got the shaft!! This location lost my business for good and I will spread the word! The one in Knoxville, Tennessee is a trillion times better!

Prices are HORRIBLE! For the cost of living in the Greenville area these prices are inflated. Had 2 apps and 4 drinks and it cost $80. I can enjoy happy hour at a fine dining restaurant in our town for half that price. Will never return.

Do not waste your time on this poorly run restaurant. Others who've reviewed it, voicing their angst re the long wait are 100% right!  The snooty hostess will tell you the wait is far less than what it really is.  We believe this is done to keep from turning people away but, to us, it is dishonest.  We didn't have 1.5 hours to wait for poor service and subpar food.  Btw, the meatloaf is horrible as were a couple other dishes in our party.  We love The Cheesecake Factory but this one is really lacking in service and food.  If we're ever in Greenville again, we probably won't return unless the reviews go way up.  Unfortunate that a brand new restaurant is so bad.  A good manager could turn this sinking ship around and I suspect they're already looking for another!

The food was alright overall, but if you want to experience the taste of their cheesecake. It isn't all great either. I've actually had better for much cheaper price than the measly slice they give you ranging from $8.95-$10. The wait for our food took longer than any usual dining time. They had a lot of menu items that they were out. And we had to wait an additional 15 mins to receive just one slice of cheesecake.

My wife and I have wanted to try The Cheesecake Factory for a long time and we're excited to her when it was coming to Greenville.  We finally made it in on Monday night.  We were quoted 2 hours for a table, but was expected as it just recently opened.   After about a half hour of waiting a couple seats opened up at the bar and decided to give it a try and are very glad we did. From the initial greet by the smiling bartender Shirley to the desert everything was absolutely amazing. We were greeted almost immediately and decided to try  couple of the specialty cocktails on her sughestion.  I took her suggestion on the Mai Tai and my wife did the same on the Strawberry Martini amd they were some of the best freshly made cocktails we have had amywhere.  She took her time to make them perfext for us, but still managed to serve us quickly all while handling a chaotic bar. When it came time to order entrees I took another one of suggestions on the Pasta Da Vinci and my wife had the Filet Mignon.  The Pasta Da Vinci is now my favorite pasta dish anywhere in Greenville and her filet was one of the most tender cuts she has ever had. Next up was desert! She suggested the Salted Caramel Cheesecake and one of her favorites the Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake and we were not dissapointed.  Both were amazing and probably the best cheesecake we both have ever had. The whole experience was perfect and what made it so wonderful was the expierence at the bar.  We almost always dine at a table when we go out to eat, but whenever we visit The Cheesecake Factory we will definitely only dine at the bar.  Thanks for the amazing night out!

There should be more bad reviews for this location. Charlotte CF has always been worth the time and price, this one in Greenville SC, no way! Long wait for the food to come out, cold Steak Diane and Salmon, no offer for a free slice of cheesecake after sitting there watching my friend eat alone for 10 minutes, over $75 for the two us us for LUNCH.... I could go on and on about how they did not even come close to meeting my expectations. If the waiter wonders why I didn't leave him a tip, YOU SERVED ME COLD FOOD, then when you did finally bring me a hot dish, you took my Iced Tea AWAY for 5 minutes to refill the glass just when I had HOT FOOD in front of me! Drive 1/2 mile up the road to Stax to see how refilling drinks is done properly.

Ordered fillet mignon steak since they ran out of ribeye steak and butter. I ordered falafel salad. Falafel was uncooked well.  My wife steak Dian mushroom were burned. Called the manager but what could happen???? Worst experience in any of cheesecake location I went to.... sorry but the manager doesn't give a c   When we wanted to talk to him he went and hid in the back

We came for lunch on Sunday and were immediately seated at 11 am.  I had the bacon bacon cheeseburger which was to die for and hubby had the pasta carbonara which was delicious.  The cheesecake selection is also great.  I took off a star because it appeared they were understaffed and we sat for 10 minutes before we saw a waitress.  We actually had one couple sit down next to us and get up and leave when no one came to them.  I had to wait for ketchup and burger got cold and had to ask multiple times for extra salad dressing.  Our waitress was very sweet but overworked!!!!!!

First, it's not five star dinning. But the lies and stupidity on these reviews makes wants to do it.  Yes, you will wait. So what. Calling before you come isn't going to guarantee a short wait. If you think Yard House is better, you don't have any taste.  The reviewer who said that the Chicken and Waffles are disgusting clearly can't read because its Benedict and comes with Hollandaise!  We tried it on our last visit and its wonderful! Horrible prices is another lie. It's clearly on the level of other restaurants in Greenville. Going to anything else in the same range will cost you the same.  Service is a bit slow because the servers have a lot of tables and it seems like entering a order takes a few minutes. That is something that needs to be fixed, there's too many servers waiting to enter orders in not enough computers. That's not your server's fault and you shouldn't lie or tip down because of it.  And yes, this is smaller then the Charlotte location. Unfortunately, all the newer Cheesecake Factory's are being made that size. That's s corporate decision and it's stupid, but not the fault of anyone working at this location.
Excellent food, excellent service! A bit pricey, so I'll probably only visit on special occasions. Would have given 5 stars otherwise.

HOLY CRAP THIS PLACE IS EXPENSIVE..!!! The service is good and the food is amazing. However, the location is quite small. I'm surprised a place this popular across the US has a place this small. Be ready to wait a while for a seat. Also, beware the drink menus, they don't list prices. We had 2 mojitos (that were mostly ice), and 2 items off the lunch menu, and 1 slice a carrot/cheese cake to share ... $75 lunch!!! Drinks were $13 each..! I loved the food here, it really is quite good. Just about everything we saw being delivered looked perfect, and mouth watering.  Our lunch was great! The pizza and salad, Shepard's pie and desert were all very tasty. Long story short, great food but at top dollar. I had lunch at Ruth Chris last week for less.

After reading all the reviews I was a little nervous.  We visited on Sunday and had a party of 12.  We were told a wait of 1 1/2 hrs.  Not surprising for such a large party.  Our table was ready in 1 hour 35 mins.  Nailed that pretty well.   Our server Katie was amazing.  She was the only server for our large party and did an amazing job.   Food was good,  a little pricey, our bill was 66.00 for 2 adults and a child.  We will be back.
This is a fabulous place for those who are comfortable with over-indulgence and pants with elastic waistbands.

I have to give a huge round of applause to Stacy and the Cheesecake Factory for doing an amazing job with a recent order.  I had a large order (12 appetizers and entrees, and 11 slices of cheesecake) and I called the day before to see what would be the easiest way to submit it and ensure that I was able to pick it up on time.  Stacy was extremely pleasant and told me to call back the morning of my order to place it and instructed me to use curbside pick up.  The order was ready in 30 minutes, and they brought the entire thing to my car.  Each order was individually labeled and everything with the order was correct.  The food was delicious and the office employees that we were thanking with the lunch were beyond happy! I was apprehensive about getting everything on time and done correctly due to the size of the order based on experiences with other restaurants, but CF pulled it off flawlessly! Thanks again Stacy and staff for giving us a fantastic lunch!

The food was good bit I didn't expect it to be so expensive.  I had the orange chicken which was really good.  There was a 45 minute wait for a party of two. It was longer actually because after our pager went off, we had to wait another 20 minutes for a server to put us at a table. I didn't get to try a cheesecake because we had to wait another 30 minutes to get our food. By the time I had ate, I was ready to go.

Let's see, where do I begin? I'll cut straight to the chase. The menu is absolutely too large, too versatile and many items should simply not be on there. I think if they hired a real chef to sample everything on the menu and subtract the garbage then they would definitely go up a couple of stars. The margherita pizza was child's size and too much cheese, no signs of tomatoes except what was puréed into the sauce and bland. I felt like I was mostly just eating crust. It was that bad. However other menu items were nice, namely one of the appetizers which wasn't order by me but I sampled it. It was a Cajun style crab dip with toasted bread. Quite nice. Chunks of crab meat you can see is always a plus. The cheesecake was alright (once again same scenario, I merely sampled it) but was covered up in way too much extra sauce and mountains of whipped cream instead of letting the cheesecake itself be the star of the show. Overall there are too many other restaurants that are better in the area, which was a disappointment because upon entering you feel set for an excellent dinner or lunch judging by the atmosphere alone. One they weed out all of the rubbish on the menu, I would be happy to give it another go. The spinach dip tastes like spinach from a can and bland. Not worth it, especially considering how overpriced everything was which is always fine in my book, but you'd better deliver the flavor. Stay away from the "pizza".
Food was good. Took FOREVER to get our food. Over an hour AFTER we got seated. The server recognized that it took so long but never saw a manager.  Unacceptable in my book.

I love the Cheesecake Factory in Charlotte- we've also eaten at the one in Denver, CO.  It was great too.  I've eaten at this one another time and it was pretty on pointe.  That was NOT the case this time.   We were ok with the wait time- new restaurant in Greenville and people are crazy and all.  Our server, however was a pompous young man, who thought he was smarter than the system, and did not write 1 single thing our party of 6 ordered down.  Not one thing.  Two other very nice ladies did all of the food bringing, drink refilling, etc.  Our appetizer came and went, and when our server breezed by (looking completely overwhelmed and incompetent) he stated that our appetizer would be out shortly.  We did let him know that it had already come and gone.  Oops. When our food came, my salad wasn't even the salad I wanted, my aunts side salad had balsamic dressing in it- with her ranch she asked for on the side (??). My moms eggs were cold, no extra plate for the two people sharing... then when I asked for the salad I ordered he argued with me about what I ordered.  He was gracious enough to take it away, and off my bill- but no dinner for me.   The cheesecake- while delicious, took forever to get to the table.  My 5 yr old niece was told they were out of ice cream when she asked for ice cream.  No forks came with the cheesecake, so we had to wait even longer for him to come back with those.  I guess my feedback is- if you're not going to bother writing your customers orders down for your overpriced food- then you better get the orders right.  Oh- the restrooms were horrendous.  No toilet paper in the stall I used- just empty rolls with 2 additional rolls SITTING ON THE BACK OF THE TOILET. Gross.  Just laziness!! One of the other stalls was the same.  Come on people- if you're charging $18 for a salad that isn't even the right salad- put some toilet paper on the roll.  Even though this is SC- we do not like our TP just hanging out sitting on the toilet.  Just gross.  Also- you should put a sign at the mall entrance saying something like "Exit Only" or please come ALL THE WAY to the hostess station.  People would continuously walk in there and just stand there like "what do we do? Where do we go?" Pretty awkward.

Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. We did curbside to go and the service was excellent. All the food came out quickly and accurately. I usually get the pasta da vinci and is was as good as always.  We live in Charlotte were home to try the new location. Never time we will go in and see how they handle it all inside.

We decided to try the Cheesecake Factory on a weekend. That was apparently our first mistake. We pushed through the crowd and got to the desk where we were given a ticket but the woman at the desk was extremely overwhelmed. Our wait time was estimated at an hour but the buzzer would not work past a few feet outside of the door so we were unable to walk around for an hour. It was extremely hot outside and we were standing by a window in the baking sun. I looked inside and saw that the max capacity of that joint was around 250 people. Judging by how full it was plus the tons of people outside that were not moving and were extremely upset, I knew that it would take a lot longer than an hour to get in. We gave the buzzer back and went elsewhere to eat. That food is not worth the hassle!

So we just got done with our food.  The server made it up for the long wait.  Very nice and polite.  Came back checking in often got our food quick also. We didn't have to wait to make an order or ask for a refill. He stayed on top of it.  Good job

Only reason I'm giving 1 star is because I can't give 0. We were told 50 min wait time which actually took 90 minutes. There were 6 in our party and they completely lost one of our orders/meals. When it finally arrived it was wrong 1 hour after they served the first 5 meals. They did comp us a whole 1 slice of cheese cake.

Sitting here at the table waiting for my food. I thought I'd come during lunch because there wasn't a waitlist. Thank god I ordered two small plates for appetizers because it's been well over half hour and my main dish isn't here. This is not ideal if you're on a lunch break. They need more time to get their service straight!

Great chain however this location is not very well thought out. Capacity is certainly an issue and the food was average at best compared to others. To bad as it is clearly popular judging by the wait times. With so much to chose from in the Upstate and far better food you may want to go elsewhere

Shannon, the bartender, greeted me immediately. I came in starving and a little "on edge". Ordered a glass of red wine. I had the ahi tartar for an appetizer. Refreshing and enough to hold me over for dinner. I decided on the steak Diane medium rare for dinner. Mark cooked my steak to perfection! Ended with (no judgement, but enlightened encouragement from Shannon) on 3 cheesecakes Togo. My first time at his location and won't be my last! Thanks for making me feel welcome being all alone! See you soon!

First time to this location since it opened 6-7 months ago. Cheesecake Factory food is good, but not sure the wait is worth the experience. Empty tables were everywhere yet we had to wait 30 minutes. Once seated, we found out why.. no servers.  We finally were seated it took 10 minutes to get a server. We received our drinks, asked for sweetener, never came. Asked for bread.. we were informed they had bread but no butter.. they "ran out". We said ok, we will take without butter.. still no bread. Cannot find server, never got her name, still no food.. no refills, no bread, no nothing.  Think our first visit will be our last visit..

I'll start off by saying that My wife and I love the Cheesecake Factory.  Went there with some friends Sunday and wow was the service bad.  Took at least forty minutes just to get the food.  Manager came out and blamed it on Sunday breakfast crowd even though everyone else got their food before us.  She said it was maybe because we ordered something complicated.  You know, if your service sucks, blame the customer.  Terrible.  She never apologized just asked if we wanted more bread.  I didn't receive my pasta until 10 minutes after the rest of the table.  Never had this problem at a Cheesecake Factory.  Guess they just don't have it right in Greenville.  We will be hesitant to come back.   Btw, the food order delay was so much our fault that the manager took it off the bill.  She didn't even come over and apologize and tell us she was doing that.  Our server who seemed embarrassed about the service had to tell us.   Maybe this Manager needs some more training!!!

My wife and I had intended to eat here today.  We decided to eat elsewhere when we were unable to call ahead or make a reservation and saw the crowd in front of the restaurant.  At a minimum there was a 2 hour wait. We did call and confirm this.  So, after dinner elsewhere we decided to make this our desert, even if we got it to go.   We called in and were hung up on twice, the third time were placed on hold for a long time but an order was finally placed.  During that call we were recommended to use curb side pick up.  We agreed to curbside and explained that we were already outside.  The wait time was expressed as 35 minutes.  Now, mind you that this was for 2 pieces of cheesecake.   During my hour long wait (that was supposed to be 35 minutes) the mall security guard tried to run me off as the curbside spaces were completely full and cars were beginning to line up on the cub beside these spaces out of the way.  Multiple times I observed people pulling up and walking in and leaving with their food, yet we waited.   At the hour mark we called to check an eta...   At that time we were told that there was at least 20 more tickets ahead of us and that it takes how long it takes.   I parked and walked in.  I was able to locate a manager who had a less than considerate tone when I explained my circumstances.  His only question was in a smart tone "what do you want?" ...   I responded, and at this point pissed doesn't begin to express my personal state "I want you to sell me the food we ordered or you can tell me that it's unavailable, but either way, I'm leaving". Suddenly, they had just walked the food outside, then he told me that it had gone out a couple times.  Now, the young lady delivering the food outside had walked out a few times while I was there.  She had to walk past us to get to other cars.  She never returned inside with food that she couldn't deliver.   So, I give one star as a gift.  The incompetence in keeping stated time lines on food that doesn't have to be cooked, merely cut, boxed, and walked outside is bad.  The personality and attitude of the small framed guy that introduced himself to me as the restaurant manager is the reason I'll not return.   ____________________________________________________________ In response to the invitation from the Cheesecake Factory to go to their contact page and follow a link so that they may speak with me...   So, my review above outlines how you originally wasted my wife's and my time by operating what the other reviews outline as a poorly run restaurant.  Your response to my review was to invite me to your website to fill out a form to state the same thing I stated here.  Yet another waste of time.  You really don't get it, customer service that is.  Here is what I expect from a restaurant.  Honesty, I.e. Give me a basic understanding of how long I have to wait, I'll decide on my own if you and I will continue our relationship from that point.  Be courteous and thankful, I.e. If I decide to continue our relationship you should be polite/ courteous as well as thankful that of all the ways available for me to spend my money that I've chosen you as a recipient.  Be neat and tidy, I don't expect a restaurant to ever be disheveled looking...  Speaks to pride in yourself, if you don't care enough to keep it neat, well then neither will anyone else.  Pride in your work, simple really, serve a meal that you would be proud to receive.  Priced accordingly, I don't expect to pay filet mignon prices for hamburger...   But I also expect to pay for what I get.   If your service staff are doing their job correctly and your kitchen staff are as well...   It shouldn't take all afternoon to complete a meal.  This means your wait times are reduced.   If you truly want to speak to me about my experience, and why I'm not coming back to your Greenville location...   Give me a phone number, I will call it.  The canned answer on Yelp, doesn't get it done.

Bad experience tonight! Won't be going back! First of all we waited 1.5 hrs for a table of 2 even though there were plenty available. And then ordered a Filet cooked medium well to share along with an appetizer and drinks. After waiting 35 mins we were delivered a steak that had too much fat for a Filet but even worse, it was still bleeding and had blood on the plate even though we ordered medium well. There was no steak knife for us to cut with and no extra plate to share on. We politely asked the waitress if we could get it cooked just a bit more  (we weren't even really upset at this point) and she was nice and said absolutely, we want to get it right. While we were waiting again,  1 of the "managers" came out and proceeded to tell us rather rudely and confrontationally that the steak we sent back was "cooked perfectly medium well" and "if we didn't want any pink we should ask for it to be well done." We told him we'd been multiple times before and never had an issue with medium well having blood on the plate. He walked away without saying anything else, much less apologizing. When the waitress came back, my husband asked to speak to the same manager as the more we thought about it  the more unprofessional it became to come confront and argue with us about how we wanted our $30 steak cooked when we were very polite in our request. Another manager came out and said that guy was "unavailable" and he couldn't understand why he'd say something like that. We decided we didn't want to spend $30 on that steak and whatever else was done to it while in the back and instead of offering to comp our meal he said he'd give us 1 piece of cheesecake to go. Great, thanks! We will be saving our time and money from this establishment from now on!! We typically spend $150 when we take our family of 6 there but not anymore!!

Of course the Cheesecake Factory in Greenville lives up to their great reputation. Service was excellent, food was great, and the cheesecake was phenomenal. I usually order the Louisiana Chicken Pasta, but the meatloaf, Romano Chicken, and Mac N Cheese balls are also delicious. Everything on the menu is great.

While the cheesecake factory has phenomenal food and desserts my few dinning experiences have been slightly less impressive. Having to stand awkwardly behind the host stand while waiting for someone to seat us was slightly uncomfortable but what really bothered me most was my waitress not writing down our orders and having to return to the table to confirm multiple times what we were having. not surprising the girl did not get my order right the 1st but did come to double check it before sending in my correct order. we were sitting on the patio and the gentlemen were smoking very close by and while several servers made eye contact with the gentlemen no one seemed to concered with our discomfort as the whole patio stunk like smoke within minutes.    the food is AMAZING but the service has left something to be desired at least for me.
Two words.......very disappointed....... Over priced and slow service. I've enjoyed the food court better.

Visited The Cheesecake Factory tonight in Greenville, SC. The entire experience was perfect. We were a party of 3, it was a busy Saturday night, we waited only 15 minutes. We had a fantastic waiter, I forgot his name, but it was about 5:30pm and we sat right behind the check-in desk. All the entrees we ordered were all tasty. We were so full that we had to get our cheesecake to-go. I got the Godiva one and It may possibly be the best things I have ever eaten. It really was that good. We will definitely be returning!
Great food & awesome service. Never a disappointment & the manager has done an amazing job getting settled in to Greenville.

Cheesecake Factory has great food, no doubt. Expensive, but you get what you pay for.  My only problem is the blatant lie they tell you for the wait time. I've been there three times and each time they have lied to me and printed off a ticket with a forty minute wait time. Forty minutes ALWAYS turns into two hours.  The third time we went was a disaster where we waited THREE hours for our table (when promised a forty minute wait time of course)! When I felt like I was going to pass out from being so hungry, I approached a hostess and asked her for an estimate on how much longer it would be. She asked me how long I'd been waiting and when I told her three hours she laughed at me (to this day, I can't tell if she was being sarcastic or not). In shock, I just pointed to the ticket because along with your wait time it tells you what time you orginally arrived.  She was stunned and quickly gave us a random empty table. I'm unsure as to why we couldn't have gotten that table earlier or why it was empty, but I have no idea how they run their restaurant.  I get insanely irritated when they print off a ticket with a forty minute wait time when they know just as well as I do that they're not going to seat me  anywhere close to forty minutes time.  My family and I most likely won't be returning.

This was the absolute worst service I have ever experienced in a restaurant.  Their name is the only thing that will make them survive in Greenville.  They were short on staff, appetizer was burnt, manager was non-existent in   the problems.  We waited 45-minutes and did not get a drink refill.

The food was great and the service was good especially considering how busy they were. (It was,a 50 minute wait.) The food much better than most chains at about the same cost point. I mainly went for the novelty of it since I really hate being herded around waiting on a table. Conclusion if it happens to be a fifteen minute wait, eat there.  If the wait is longer, go to a local restaurant.  P.S. the cheesecake was good. Not awesome.

This is a nightmare restaurant. The most accurate description I can come up with is a crowded mall crossed with a chain restaurant.  It's very, very loud, and seating is close. The prices are high for what's on offer (entrées).  I tasted someone else's cheesecake, and it was good (it's not my favorite dessert, so I'm not a great judge there). I had a lemon non-cheesecake dessert, and it had obviously been frozen and thawed to serve. Obviously, because it was still icy in spots.  I think I'll find dessert elsewhere.

Ok I have upped my star for them to a four. The cheesecakes slices seem to have improved to get a tad larger. The young waiter we had was so sweet. The seating was very fast, took us straight to a booth. We only had appetizers which was very good. We had the Cuban Rolls and a sampler dish that had fried avocado, mushrooms, zucchini. I really hope they keep improving.

I've had a Yelp account for a while, but haven't felt the need to review anything until now. I was with a group of seven people on Wednesday, December 21st. We expected a wait (with it being Christmas week and the restaurant being attached to a shopping mall) and honestly the wait for seating didn't take as long as we expected. We arrived at the restaurant at 5:30pm and were seated by 6pm. It took at least twenty minutes to receive all of our drinks and we didn't actually have an opportunity to place our orders until roughly 6:30pm. None of us ordered anything special. We stuck strictly to the menu and ordered only sandwiches and burgers. It took until 7:30pm to get any of our food and we didn't get all of our food. Our entire party received their food ten minutes before my wife and I did (no apologies, the wait staff acted like there wasn't anything wrong at all) and both of our burgers were burnt to a crisp and had almost no flavor, but the waitress never returned until it was time to pay at 8:30pm.  So, if you're keeping tabs on what happened, we spent three hours at this restaurant, had horrid service, and the food was mediocre. I'm fine with waiting for good food, but for the price of this restaurant and the lack of service and quality, I was appalled. Also, don't expect to be able to hold a conversation, the music is entirely too loud. I did not try their namesake cheesecake (far too expensive; why would I want to pay $7-8 for one slice of cheesecake?), but judging by the rest of the food, I can't expect anything good from trying it. Also, be aware that they don't take reservations (even for larger parties). Very disappointed.

Corporate restaurant moves into Greenville. Cool. Got why they are super packed every night. It's the new thing.    I m here on holiday from a place where CCF's run amok--Los Angeles -- and it was never anything to rave about let alone be ok with an 1hr wait time but like I said -I get it. What I don't get is -- why they opened up without being entirely prepared? They are fully under capacitated . It's not the customers fault that the food takes an hour to be served and the kitchen is "just overwhelmed " . Seriously? Then let's talk about the food.. mediocre at best. Chicken picatta that rates D ( it's picatta -not Alfredo's cream mushroom sauce?!) burgers are decent if they knew what med looks like. Pizza is horrible - taste like what I imagine papa Jones to be?   Over hyped and over priced for food that taste like food you can get at a diner. Only the servers that were transferred from California are great, the other trainees are inexperienced, ineffective and inefficient. Attitudes from ours seemed really weird tonight. Anyway, a repeat of the above;  Bad service, meh food, and ridiculous wait times especially for a restaurant such as CCF. The hype will blow over and it all will be just a dream ... I mean nightmare . Ok it's NOT THAT  terrible but you foodies know what I'm saying .

May have been the rudest waitress I've ever had at any restaurant. The bathroom trash cans were flowing over with paper towels and no soap. I hope the cooks used a different bathroom. I gave two stars because my wife and son liked their meal. Mine was ok. Over priced. Cheesecake was good.

Had lunch at Cheesecake Factory today with a friend.  We went about 1:30 and got seated right away.  We got hamburger sliders and french fries.  The food was very good.  The waitress was great.  She took really good care of us and love that she kept my tea glass full. i like having something to choose from other than food court when I go to mall.Next time hope to treat myself to sweet dessert.

Be prepared to wait awhile and bring wallet to spend some serious money. When we arrived we forgot it was prom night and waited 90 minutes. Food was worth it. Waiter was Steve and knew the menu inside and out. Always kept glasses filled. I was impressed how he handled his tables despite how busy it was. Even joked with us. Will be back again.

This is a pretty popular chain. We do not do chain restaurants a lot, but do like this one. I have seen a ton of reviews about bad service, but we must have been lucky. We were seated with a short wait.  Our server got to us quickly, was attentive without being overbearing, and was very polite.  Our food arrived quickly and was prepared correctly.  I hope more people have experiences like ours. We will go back when we are in the neighborhood.

My family just placed a carryout order for my birthday which happened to be over $100 worth of food. One piece of cheesecake was wrong, so we decided to call to let them know. The manager Steven Cobb basically called us liars and asked us to send him an email of a picture of the wrong cheesecake. I couldn't believe this. I have worked in customer service for over 10 years and have NEVER heard of a manager questioning the customer. Considering how much our order was for, why would we lie about an $8 piece of cheesecake? If he would have just offered to refund the one piece of cheesecake, that would have been the end of the conversation, but he decided to try to blame his employees as to why he asked for the picture when he should have further explained himself instead of insinuating that we were not being truthful at first. He then proceeded to ask for my telephone number and asked why, he said " I was going to investigate and call you back with the results.".....um, what needs to be investigated, with what results? I have never heard of something like this. I refused to have him call back and he continued to not answer my questions, pausing. This is NOT okay, and we will NOT be returning to this location. The number one rule is that the customer is always right.  Does the picture attached look like a coffee cheesecake? Clearly it is banana, but sure here's a picture of it for you.
I would have given a 5 star except I found that the cheesecake quality has diminished over the years.  However, the food was very good and the chicken samosas were fantastic.

Cheesecake Factory is my all time favorite celebration restaurant. Located in Haywood Mall, the food is good but pricey. Last 2 times I was there, the sides were cold while the chicken was hot. They need to put the sides on the plates when they put the meat on the plate, not before. For what we paid for 3 meals, I expect hot fresh food, not just the meat. And if it is supposed to have sauce ON the vegetables, put it ON them, NOT under them to speed things up when plating the food. We asked to speak to the manager but we're told he was not available. The second time this happened I told the server but she did nothing and we had to leave as we were going to a concert in North Carolina. When you spend more than $80.00 for 3 meals and dessert, I think the wait staff and managers should be available.

My husband and I went here a few weeks ago for dinner with friends. When we arrived at 6:15, we were told the wait would be 60-80 minutes, so we settled in and waited, knowing that most places in Greenville would have a long wait on a Friday night. Almost 120 minutes later, we still hadn't been seated and had been told "five more minutes" three times by the hostess. We initially checked in with her at 75 minutes (since we had seen multiple parties who arrived after us seated) and were told that since we had been given the estimate of up to 80 minutes, we wouldn't be seated a minute before that. Because one of my friends is very pregnant and was feeling dizzy, my husband went and got her a drink from the bar. The top of the glass was broken and sharp-thankfully we caught it or it could have caused a bad cut. After our buzzer finally went off, we assumed we would be seated. Instead, we were ushered to another, different waiting area where we proceeded to wait another 10 minutes. It was ridiculous, seeing that we had eyes on our table, which was empty and wasn't bussed for about 15 minutes. When we were finally seated, my friend asked the waiter if we could receive an appetizer because of our extra unexpected wait. The waiter proceeded to tell us in a snarky, sarcastic tone that he was "sorry for the wait, but we could have always turned around and gone somewhere else." It was absolutely unbelievable. And not surprisingly, the waiter came back and told us the manager said no to the appetizer. When we got our drinks and bread, my friend's coffee had spilled all over the tray and soaked the bread. Instead of getting us new bread, the waiter asked us if it was so bad that we really needed new bread. And spoiler alert: the cheesecake is great, but the food is good at best. Nothing to write home about, and definitely not worth a 2 hour wait. We won't go back.

I've heard horror stories of the wait time to be seated but went on a Wednesday evening & was seated within 5 minutes. They have a vast variety of Cheesecakes to choose from. The Red Velvet Cheesecake and the Hershey Bar Cheesecake were great. They slices are big enough to feed two people. A little overpriced in my opinion though. As for the food, mediocre at best. I'd go back for the Cheesecake but that's all.

Extremely disappointed...It has definitely been over a decade since I had been to a Cheesecake Factory and at this point I'll probably never go back. We walked in and it was freezing inside. That is a huge complaint with any restaurant in general. So we had to leave our jackets on for lunch. The waitress was prompt, but her overall service was terrible. She was slow, never smiled or asked if we were ok, but in her defense all the waiters and waitresses weren't wearing their smiles that day.  We had a salad that was great and a chicken club sandwich. How can you go wrong with a basic sandwich? Maybe the kitchen was having problems. Who knows, but the quality and taste wasn't there. I know it is always busy, but as time goes things will fizzle. Fortunately, there are an abundance of great restaurants both chain and non chain in Greenville.
I got food poisoning so I'd like to give it 0 stars, but that's not an option.  There other locations are great, but Greenville is horrid!

Tyler was our server. He is a seriously skilled individual. Very personable, polite, and seemed to know what we needed and wanted before even we knew. Our drinks were never empty, our food was fantastic and served promptly, and all special requests were honored without hesitation. A large party was sat next to us, and when I saw our server would be taking them, I had a moment of worry. Being a former waitress, I knew the challenge that potentially awaited. But his pace and attentive nature did not slow. Everything was amazing! If I were to return to the service industry, I would consider CCF! The experience was great :) Two thumbs up to Tyler and the Cheesecake Factory staff!

The waitress was nice, the menu for food and drink were large and I enjoyed the outdoor seating. Vegetarian and GF options are available. Unfortunately, my positive comments have to stop here. I know a few people who love this place and I have no clue why! The food wasn't awful, but also wasn't good.  The salads were obviously from a bag and not fresh. My husband's salad (I think it was the French country salad) didn't match the description. It sounded so good but it was mainly just lettuce with 1 spear of asparagus, 1 chunk of goat cheese and maybe 3 candied pecans. My (no so) fresh vegetable salad was mostly lettuce and salad and salad dressing.  Disappointing. If I were to come back, I'd skip dinner and would just order a mixed drink.

My husband and I went here for a nice lunch after doing some shopping at the mall.  The wait was as expected, the service was good, and the food was really good.  We split a meal and it was plenty for each of us.  I would recommend this place,

We keep giving them more chances, however when we go back we're even more disappointed. Service is very slow, the food was not good at all. Sorry, there are so many great restaurants in Greenville to eat at. Will not be coming back here.

Had lunch and was told it would be a 30 minute wait. We were sat 6 minutes which was great considering the restaurant is always packed and long wait times. I ordered the egg roll trio, very good but not what I expected. The server was not very attentive and we had to flag him down to ask to have our waters refilled. The food has a very nice presentation but was not what I expected. We ordered the Oreo cheesecake which was fabulous! If you come here I strongly recommend getting the Cheesecake! I think I will stick to coming here for apps and drinks or just the Cheesecake it's definitely worth coming back for!

I've been looking forward to visiting the Cheesecake Factory for some time now. It's always so busy and I've rarely had time to wait. So Saturday my family decided to give it a try. I was start with the positives. The hostess was really sweet as well as our server. No problems there. Now on to the food. The complimentary bread was pretty good. Other than that...our meal was definitely wasn't worth the price. I am not sure what the raving is all about. Maybe I should've just ordered cheesecake. I ordered the $18 Chicken Marsala and it looked delicious. However the pasta was not cooked well and the dish was dry. My husband ordered tacos and the black beans tasted awful. I thought he was exaggerating until I tasted them. My sons kids meal (pasta) was hard and dry as well. Our server did bring us some extra sauce to help compensate. Just not very impressed. Would've rather had Panera Bread. Oh well. Oh yeah and the bathrooms were awful.

Ate there tonight. Worst meal I've had in years. Filet was full of grissle and undercooked. Ordered a med Filet and it came out rare. They then spent 10 minutes cooking it on what was obviously low heat. Which meant I got a med well filet that was dried out and bland. They also did not trim the chain (grissle) off of the filet. Which means I did not receive a true filet. A whole side (about 1/4) of the steak was grissle and fat. They do this to gouge the customer and make more money. The green beans had zero seasonings on them. Mashed potatoes were bland. One big $30 rip off. I went by chik-fil-a on the way home so I could have a decent dinner. Oh, and I was offered a free salad or soup to make up for it! Not a drink (I was drinking beer) or dessert... but soup or salad. Very weird. Will never go back. Especially after seeing the canned corporate responses on here in response to poor reviews. How about the GM actually care enough to respond publicly to complaints...

I've been to other CCF's before and they were fantastic,but this one....not so much.  We walked in and of course it was crowded like always and we waited a little over 20 minutes to be seated which wasn't bad. Then things just kinda went downhill from there. The server wasn't very attentive and it always took her forever to come back to the table for refills or to check on us. She was probably busy with other tables as well so I'll give her that but she just did not seem very happy to be there. I had the teriyaki chicken with rice and it just wasn't good enough to be $16. The chicken was way over cooked and had black gristle all over it and it was way too hard tough to cut into. The rice was bland and tasteless and I was so disappointed because I thought it was like teriyaki chicken over rice with sauce on it but that is not the case at all and it was just awful. The cheesecake however is always the best part and I'd like to think that's why most people go to a place called the Cheesecake Factory. This one seriously lacks in the food quality section though and for over $70 for 2 people I was expecting much more.
Chicken was dry and tasteless. The pizza was 15$ for a tiny pizza that looked like a dollar frozen pizza from Walmart. And the burger was covered in grease. Don't plan on coming back.

My pizza tasted like a boxed frozen pizza. Cheap and nasty. My friends burger was loaded with grease. The chicken Parmesan sandwich is flavorless. And our service wasn't all that great. I don't know if we will be back.
Awesome food, awesome service and the staff are so funny and kind.  Mel, we enjoyed having you as our waiter!!!
This review is really only for the server who's name I forgot..... but it's always packed here and the food is meh. But I come here for the cheesecake. Of course....

This place has a service issue. Food is good, but they simply cannot keep the water glasses full. Coffee that was ordered with Cheesecake was barely warm.  Too many good restaurants in Greenville to waste your time here.
Tables are too close together and service is mediocre. The food is good but too pricey for the overall experience.
Very slow....food was wrong, then undercooked then finally received when others were done, meal was not comped nor did a manager apologize, cheesecake was not as described, will not return
The bussers are super grumpy--probably cause they work too many hours, bad experience, 10/10 would not recommend

Disappointing...2nd time here since they opened last year...We were seated quickly (about 15 minutes) and ordered 2 Westbrook IPA's.  We have had this beer before (usually very good) and these were flat and stale.  We ordered 2 entrees and 2 kids meals. It took a long time for our order to arrive and when it finally did, my 11 y.o. daughter's order was wrong.  Waiter apologized and said he put a rush on the correct order, yet it showed up about 30 minutes later. So the rest of us had almost finished and shared with my daughter when her food finally showed up. I will say my ahi tuna was good. My 8 yo daughter ordered kids pasta and it was hard and chewy, like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for a while.  In light of this, you would think they might comp a kids meal or piece of cheesecake or beer or something (we ordered cheesecake to go) but no. The table next to us seemed to be having similar problems with orders and timeliness. We have enjoyed CF in other cities in the past but this one seems unorganized and average at best.  MANY better options in Greenville.
No wait but came on July 4. Good service. always consistently good food. Gigantic portions which reflects on the listed calories on the menu. Couple minor order errors otherwise good and satisfying.

The wait is long. The menu is gigantic and obviously written by someone with serious attention deficit disorder. The food is mediocre at best. Worst of all, the place is unsafe due to the 'no concealed weapons' sign on the door. Even though the sign is obviously incorrectly placed, this leaves everyone in the place sitting ducks for any lunatic wanting to shoot up the place and disarms the law abiding citizens who might save the day in such a case. Dine at your own risk.
Tries to eat here for lunch... was seated immediately but I gave up and left after no one had come by my table after 10 minutes.

I don't care much for chain food in the first place but I was at the mall... All the staffers that interacted with me were sweet, that said...  it's called the Cheesecake Factory, not the great food or atmosphere factory, thats my once and done, that's all

My 1st visit was disappointing. I ordered some type of Cajun pasta. It had the worst flavor and it had PEAS! Who wants peas in their Cajun pasta?! Der. Anyway, the chicken strip kids meal & red velvet cake were quite delicious. :) can't go wrong with a kids meal according to the kiddo... 2nd visit was a-1 & without a cheesecake. I had the fabulously sauced and portioned buffalo strips, a burger, Sangria(can't go wrong) and the can't go wrong kids meal. Next visit on the schedule!

We came to this location around 5:15 on a Friday night.  The interior was really loud and chilly, to the point of being uncomfortable, but we had a choice, and chose outside seating.  That was a great choice. Our server was attentive and took care of us.  I enjoyed my blood orange margarita, it had great flavor.  Our food was good, huge portions.  What they consider spicy, we do not, but that's typical of chains.  We got our cheesecake to go, and enjoyed it later.   If you go during peak hours, you'll have to wait.  We had a gift card from Christmas, and timed our visit to minimize our wait.  Food and service is above average for a chain.

My kid's ate at the Greenville, SC location last week and both had diarrhea soon afterwards.  My daughter put her leftovers in my refrigerator and I was brave enough to try & eat it. There were (2) large "palm-sized" chicken planks in her 2-Go box. I picked-up the larger one and it felt as if the contents was loose from the outer crust. I decided to open it up before heating and was totally amazed at how little chicken meat was actually inside. "Maybe (2) teaspoons of meat, the rest was the outside "breading" or whatever. (2) teaspoons, NOT tablespoons... UNBELIEVABLE... I'm sure she paid $8+ for her meal. What a TOTAL ripoff... NEVER going back there again. Be weary of this chain (if they all prepare food like this)... Take Care UPDATE (4-28-17) My daughter told me that she paid $24 for the Buffalo Chicken Bites, one piece of cheese cake ($6) and a drink...  I was brave enough to open-up the 2nd chicken plank she brought home in a 2-Go box and believe me or not, it had only about (1) teaspoon of chicken meat inside of the hand-sized breading...  My $8 estimate was a HUGE undermine to the actual cost. She, nor my son will EVER go back, trust me. Money is too hard to come by to blow in places like this...

The Cheesecake Factory is always an experience. I think I've tried one in every city. They have so many options. I think anyone can find something on the menu they like. Since this is a new location, it was packed. My Mom and I really wanted to go here, so we decided to be a part of the madness. However, we got seated right away in the bar section. It was a bit rocky after that. We didn't see a waiter or waitress after sitting for about 15 minutes. And almost simultaneously two ladies walked up to us and asked what we would be having to drink. Now we never really figured out which one was our waitress because they both checked on us and brought us things. I'm not complaining.  I had the Thai Coconut Lime Chicken, but substituted it for shrimp. My mom had the Grilled Steak Medallions with mashed potatoes. I enjoyed my food and so did my mom, but she complained that the portion was small, which was surprising for Cheesecake Factory. They're known for their portion sizes. However, I couldn't eat all of my food, which was a good portion size so I shared. After the food, we didn't have room for dessert.  And after looking at all the Cheesecake options and the calories associated, they became a turnoff. Overall, good experience. Parking was crazy, but it is located at the Haywood Mall, so that's pretty much unavoidable. I'll be back but for cheesecake only.

It's been a while we went after they had Been open 4 months. We had to wait 45 minutes after we order for my 3 year old's kids pizza. Our waiter only refilled our drinks once and we received our bread after 20 minutes. I feel sorry for those who assume that this Cheesecake Factory is like others. It's like an illustration of the fall of Rome if it were a restaurant. We haven't been back and based on others input we will not.

The food is pretty good, but the service has been poor both times. The first time, we waited more than 30 minutes for our food even though we were one of the 1st 3 tables seated for brunch upon the restaurant opening.  Second time, we were ignored for a while before ever seeing our server, although several servers passed our table with not so much as a smile.  Also, it is like pulling teeth to get a drink refill! And, this was brunch as well. I can't imagine being there at dinner when they are actually busy.

Overrated. Tried this place twice now and have had nothing but disappointments. I am shocked that so many folks think THIS is the destination foody outlet of Greenville.  Went for a simple meal and a drink. Ordered blue moon draft ($7!! That's a rip off) and a $13 horrible dirty martini I had to send back. By the way this is the time to tell you that THEY DONT LIST THEIR DRINK PRICES ON THE MENU  and when I asked the waitress how much she gave me a "ballpark" of $9-12 dollars. After I saw a whole piece of ice floating in my "shaken" martini and tasted how poorly  balanced it was, I called our amazing waitress Brittany (who was quadruple sat) and explained exactly what was wrong with my drink.  I then watched the bar tender roll her eyes, deny she had some anything wrong, and pour it right back into her shaker then simply add 3-5oz of olive juice, shake, and return the martini to me. Ps- THAT was actually more palatable than what you made me in the first place! The two of us had 2 drinks and skinny veggie burgers with a small salad with only lettuce and dressing for $60!  Great service- Thank you Brittany!!! Horrible bartender- will NEVER go back again for drinks. Passable food- but for the price we will go elsewhere from now on.

Getting ready to treat my wife out to a birthday meal here, tonight. From what I see in the remarks and reviews, there are mixed feelings. Some liked it with five stars and some disliked it terribly with one star. Well, I hope our experience exceeds five stars!  Considering the price, we should only expect the best. In our case, we are not an unreasonable picky couple and it doesn't take a lot to please us. Hoping for the best!!
Horrible experience with curbside. 40 minutes for Cheesecake and it wasn't busy. They also told me it wasn't busy and barely offered an apology.

I almost say, don't,  almost.  There was no joy in the meal, only disgust, I'll make do to keep from embarrassing him. Skinnylicious chicken salad sandwich was Awful!  Nothing skinny about greasy toasted bread that taste like a dirty grill.  I ask before I ordered if the chicken was minced  or finely chopped. She said yes. That's why I ordered it.  Nope, chunks of poorly cut white chicken with gristle.  I showed it to her.  Not to mention the gooped thick mayo. I gagged.  It came with a side salad. Thank goodness!  I tool the sandwich apart. Added to the side salad to make do with what I had left.   The tomatoe slices tasted hot n old certainly wasn't fresh. I won't do this again.  Disappointed to say the least
Wonderful grilled salmon, awesome cheesecake! 5 pm on Friday - no wait. Server very good - Shayla! I Great meal!

I enjoy eating out now and then.  I'm a bit of a foodie who doesn't mind paying for a good experience.  One thing I'm opposed to is paying a good bit for a poor experience. We've eaten at Cheesecake Factory in Maryland, Charlotte, and here in Greenville.  This experience in particular was quite bad overall but I'm not sure if it was due to a "changing of the guards" in how the Greenville facility is run or maybe an isolated incident so take it with a grain of salt.   We walked in and were promptly seated but in a way that didn't make sense to most guys. A string of tables in front of one long bench/booth with chairs toward the dining area. People seated at each end and we were sat right next to one couple with probably six empty tables beside us. (Why does this not make sense to guys? Because it's similar to bathroom urinal etiquette. You don't go right next to someone else until you have no choice.  It's common courtesy to give space.)  So with the music blaring so we couldn't hear each other at typical conversation level from three feet away, we await our server.  I had no clue what I wanted to drink but the other half did so she ordered. After six or seven minutes the server (I believe her name was Amy) returns and begins to take our order but nay, the kobe burger is no longer on the menu and she disappears once again to the kitchen to check if it is, in fact, still available.  Nearly ten minutes later she returns again without mention of the burger but ready to take our orders. Our orders were taken and eventually returns with my beer but the water I ordered didn't arrive for nearly ten more minutes. I honestly wondered if she failed to hear me state I'd wanted a water as well. The spinach/artichoke dip was to come as our appetizer which alone was a disappointment to me. Far too much bitter spinach with a small amount of milky broth and parmesan melted over the top. It wasn't but three or four minutes later that our main dishes arrived. I imagine I had "that look" on my face because they offered to take it all back to the kitchen but it was too late. Sitting under a heat lamp is no better than in front of us at the table. This is very poor timing on the part of the kitchen manager making sure things go out in a timely manner.  Our server checked back if I wanted a refill on my beer which I was definitely in the mood for by now.  It never did come....  Neither did water refills.  Amy disappeared several more times between bringing the check, taking our order for cheesecake to-go, bringing boxed leftovers, etc.  I can't in good conscience recommend this place anymore. With an $80+ tab for two people, this is ridiculous. I may give this restaurant another chance down the road but it will certainly be considerable time until I do.    Management needs to be mindful of plate timing going out to the tables.  Servers need to be attentive to their customers needs and actually write something down if you're having a hard time remembering it (yes, this means you, Amy). Maybe question your customers as to where they'd like to sit, seeing as it wasn't very busy at 3pm on a Friday there was plenty of room. And most certainly don't disappear for long periods when the restaurant isn't very busy at all.  If you can't handle the slow times, how you can you adequately handle it when it's seriously busy, as is the reputation here.
Had a party of 5. Seated in less than an hour. Waitress was very attentive, the French fries were cold but the rest of the food was on point.
This probably the best restaurant in the mall district.  We have been coming to Cheesecake Factory for years and never left un satisfied.  Great customer service and great options of foods.

For a restaurant that seems to tout itself as a nice/special occasion restaurant, I expected a touch more customer service.
