My wife and I went in for dessert on our anniversary, and as the waiter comes up, a bug crawls out from under my wife's bread plate and across the table. The server pulls out a receipt and smashes it in the corner of the table against the wall. That's one thing eating on the patio...it's another in the restaurant--not exactly appetizing. The server mentioned he would go tell the manager. The server comes back and wipes the table with a rag and takes our order. That was the end of any discussion. Now we weren't there to make a scene, so we simply asked for some fresh silverware, ate, and paid the full check. Just seemed more like management (assuming they were told by the server) would be more proactive in a situation like that to at least stop by and apologize. But nothing. Just wiping up a dead bug with a rag off our table. Expected more.

Tried to put in a Curb Side Pickup order and got put on hold for 30 minutes. I showed up, still on hold. When I told the host and the "manager" they just said a half hearted sorry with no attempt to make the experience right. Very disappointed in service like this for such a well known company. I won't be returning

Horribly mediocre and overpriced. The food is obviously frozen. I can't understand why this place is always busy, unless they are first timers like I was who will never go back. There are so many local restaurants around that prepare fresher and better food, why would you wait in line to eat food from a chain restaurant that serves only fair tasting cheesecake?

Thought it was the kitchen having issues but finally decided it was kitchen and waiter.  One person at our table wasn't ready to order so waiter said he'd come back. It was fifteen minutes. Kitchen ran out of mashed potatoes so our food was held. They finally decided to serve our food and bring the potatoes when they were done. We had almost finished eating before we got them. Had to ask for every refill. Waiter was very friendly and maybe he had too many tables. We were there 2 1/2 hrs

The Cheese Cake Factory is a great place to eat. I feel they are a little over priced and there is way to many choices on the menu. It literally takes fifteen minutes to get through the entire menu, but once you do and get your food,  that makes it all better.

Excellent food and service. Our waitress Aubrey was amazing. It's been a long time since I've had service that was this on point. The wait was typical of an evening dinner rush, but the time went by quickly due to wonderful conversation and wonderful service. Will definitely be returning.
Tried to place a to-go order and instead sat on the phone 20 minutes. Tried calling twice-nothing. Rather eat somewhere else-the service is not up to par.

Ate here for the first time today, we were underwhelmed. The egg roll appetizer was great. My boyfriend got the chicken dish that they are known for, his chicken was undercooked. The chef and manager looked at the chicken, and said they could make him another piece of chicken, but my boyfriend lost his appetite. They did not offer any comp of any sort for their mistake. We will not be coming back.

BEAUTIFUL! WONDERFUL!  Awesome experience from arriving to leaving! The atmosphere was breathtaking! Sat at the bar with Bret and had a wonderful time! He was not just a bartender, but engaged with us our entire visit. He was very funny! The food and cocktails were A plus!
Lunch with my BFF....The food was great, our waiter was very friendly and the customer service was good.

This is probably one of the most disgusting Cheesecake Factory's I've ever been to. After an awkward walk with the host I was greeted by a fly on my napkin. But after a 15 minute wait for my drink order I figured that the soap scummed forks and copious amount of flies was my cue to leave. Enjoy!

This place is beautiful to eat at but way over priced. The food isn't even that good. Its actually something you can make better at home. The cheesecake isn't golden cheesecake it's just cheesecake like what you purchase at walmart. I think it's a good place to go once is a super mega while but not even.
Me and my friends came here few times! The foods  are just okay! Some really good some just fine! Service is great.

As my job requires me to travel quite a bit I've eaten a The Cheesecake Factory in several cities and have a generally formed opinion about my experience at all of them.  I was meeting a friend for lunch and I arrived early so I was able to request a table not part of the general pop row of seats that share one long bench seat with like six other tables.   As always, the meal started with a bowl of sweet butter served with some bread to put it on.  We stared off by ordering the Chicken Pot Stickers, they are always a big hit.  The Soy-Ginger Sauce is salty and flavorful and the meat is tender and moist.   I decided to venture away from my normal order and instead try the Southwest Chicken Sandwich.  Props to me, that was the right call.  I was pleasantly surprised to find the jalapeño peppers on the sandwich were actually spicy as was the Chipotle Mayo.  As someone who enjoys spicy foods, I may have a new go-to for future visits.  The Toasted French Baguette makes it a little difficult to eat, but does add a nice flavor.  For dessert I asked for a recommendation and the waitress recommended the Lemoncello Cream Torte, excellent choice.  I have to say, the tart lemon with the sweet vanilla cake, streusel and mascarpone was a fantastic combination.  I'm glad she recommended it. I fully expected to be giving this a three star review, but to be fair, this was a far better experience than my last visit to this location.  I'm going to assume the restaurant has just improved and give them a score based on this visit.  I would also point out, this is the score I would give if this were some mom and pop restaurant I was visiting for the first time and not a ginormous restaurant chain located in our local mall.
Grate bartender, Always good drinks and it's always pretty. Food was good. The check will knock your socks off vary expensive for what you get.

Upon our arrival it took the staff a real long time to attend to us. Finally, after I got up to inquire, we were attended by two servers. Our eventual server, Phi was great, and took care of our every request, efficiently and promptly. The food and drinks here were great, and not as costly as similiar establishments. So, great food, great service, great prices, but sloooww pickup time.

The Cheesecake Factory in Greenville, SC really needs an assessment. We waited 45 minutes to be seated only to find that the wait time was totally unnecessary.  The food took an additional 45 minutes and really was not all that great. I have had much better.  I believe the issue in this location is staffing and possible training of staff. Our server was responsible for service in various locations in the restaurant - not efficient- why not a particular area. She often forgot about our requests (to go boxes and a Carmel macchiato).  We eventually asked another sever for boxes and when I stood up to leave she realized I never received my drink and quickly when to the bar to pick it up.  Owners, pay an analyst/consultant and get things fixed. The cheesecakes are worth it NOW but eventually, we'll go elsewhere.

A great place to bring friends and family ! I had the skinnylicious shrimp tacos which were flavored very well and flavorful .My mom couldn't stop talking about how perfectly cooked and tender her steak was. My dad couldn't stop talking about how filling and fresh the ahi poke . Only down side was that the wait for the food took longer than usual, but our server was very attentive and on point the whole night.

Terrible! I called in my to go  order at 5pm and requested that i wouldn't be picking it up til 6pm and the girl assured me that she would place the order at around 5:35/5:40 so it would  be ready by then.....No it was not !! I arrived to pick  my order at around 6pm the girl kept saying it wont be long or it's on it's way and oh they are bagging it up right now only to be kept waiting yet longer!!  I had to wait there til 6:30 and finally it came out. Not even sure if they weren't the lunch portions as it seemed kind small not the usual generous dinner portions. No manager came to apologise or explain the situation!

The perfect place for a night out with my family. With a hungry 8 year old boy, the cheese sticks were out in 3 minutes!!!(lifesaver!!!) I had the eggroll sampler and the hubby enjoyed his steak Diane. Service was great, food was cooked to perfection. 5 star dining experience.

I have been twice now, and both times went well.  Obviously the cheesecake is what makes the restaurant ( I suggest the strawberry), but I am blown away by the size of the menu.  Everything I have tried is tasty.  If you have kids in toe, the kids mac n  cheese is the best I have ever tasted.  You need to know that the portions are enormous, so just plan ahead that you will be using your microwave the next day.  The restaurant itself looks fancy but doesnt have a snobbish undertone.  Greenville is better by having this place.

Around 630; Party of 2 on a Friday night Wait time of 1 hour but went shopping and buzzer went off in 35 minutes! Alcohol drinks are expensive and not worth the price. Tex mex egg rolls are amazing to start with. Portions sizes are perfect. If u are full then you should definitely take a cheesecake to go!

We will NOT be back nor will I recommend this location! I ordered the vegan Cobb salad. While it was good, my grilled asparagus was missing. I notified the server and she told me it looks just like the green beans that were in there. I told her I hadn't tasted any. (I know the difference between both vegetables.) She said she would get me "more". She indicated later she would not charge me for them. ???? After ordering cheesecakes, the manager came by to ask me how my salad was. He then proceeded to inform me that he would not charge for the asparagus this time, but next time it would be $2 extra for 2 Oz! He said the cost for asparagus was high. I used to work at another Cheesecake Factory and we never treated the customer like that. I felt like they were implying I was trying to get extra food free. This was the breaking point for me as a returning customer. I have a gift card still to be used and I will NOT be using it here.
I like the food, however the wait + the price just isn't worth it. Plus, it's located in the mall which makes it even worse for the traffic and wait.

Took my niece here for her 17th birthday ONLY because she had never been.  Our waiter was super! The food is okay but the Cheesecake was the best part of the meal.  Fish tacos, chicken pasta dish and two slices of cheesecake including tip was $75.  Cheesecake Factory was good years ago but there are far better restaurants.

Late lunch with my son. Ordered shrimp Alfredo and pasta carbonara lunch portions. Server with a smile and attentive to drinks, bread, etc. sat in the bar area for the first time. Tall bistro chairs were comfortable and spaced appropriately for personal conversations. Noise level was moderate and luckily we arrived before the TGIF crew.  Food delicious, service prompt and great company!!! A four star visit...
